byline.contributor: Falih Hassan contributed reporting from near Falluja and from Baghdad.

abstract: Fragmented coalition of Iraqi forces, Shiite militias and Sunni tribal fighters are closing in on Islamic State-held city of Falluja, Iraq, but have yet to enter, leaving fate of estimated 50,000 civilians trapped there uncertain; residents are cut off from food and medical supplies, leading humanitarian groups to warn of unfolding catastrophe.
lead_paragraph: A visit to the front showed Iraq’s fragmented security forces closing in on the city, but not yet fighting for its center, amid growing concerns about trapped civilians.

headline.main: Fear of ‘Catastrophe Unfolding’ Amid Fighting in Falluja
headline.print_headline: Near Falluja, Fear of a ‘Catastrophe Unfolding’

snippet: A visit to the front showed Iraq’s fragmented security forces closing in on the city, but not yet fighting for its center, amid growing concerns about trapped civilians.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
